channel.title: Snap on Internet Freedom Foundation
channel.description: Recent content in Snap on Internet Freedom Foundation

item.title: #SocialMediaComplianceWatch: analysis of Social Media Compliance Reports for the month of January 2022
item.description: Google (including YouTube), Facebook, Instagram (both are now under Meta), ShareChat, Snap, Twitter and WhatsApp have released their reports in compliance with Rule 4(1)(d) of the IT Rules 2021 for the month of January, 2022. We have analysed them.

item.title: #SocialMediaComplianceWatch: analysis of Social Media Compliance Reports for the month of December 2021
item.description: Google (including YouTube), Facebook, Instagram (now Meta), ShareChat, Snap, Twitter and WhatsApp have released their reports under Rule 4(1)(d) of the IT Rules 2021 for the month of Dec ‘21. The latest of these was published by Meta and was made available in late Jan ‘22. We’ve analysed them.

item.title: #SocialMediaComplianceWatch: analysis of Social Media Compliance Reports of November, 2021
item.description: Google (including YouTube), Facebook, Instagram, ShareChat, Snap, Twitter and WhatsApp have released their reports in compliance with Rule 4(1)(d) of the IT Rules 2021 for the month of November, 2021.

item.title: #SocialMediaComplianceWatch: analysis of Social Media Compliance Reports of October, 2021
item.description: Social Media platforms have released their reports for Oct 2021 in compliance with Rule 4(1)(d), IT Rules 2021. They continue to suffer from the same shortcomings, which exhibits lack of effort on the part of the SSMIs and the govt. to further transparency and accountability in platform governance.

item.title: #SocialMediaComplianceWatch: analysis of Social Media Compliance Reports of September, 2021
item.description: SSMI reports in compliance with Rule 4(1)(d) of the Information Technology (Guidelines for Intermediaries and Digital Media Ethics Code) Rules, 2021 have been analysed for the month of September.
